chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall z : Z, z <> 1 -> z <> -1 -> (z | 2) -> z = 2 \/ z = -2

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
divide_2 : forall z : Z, 0 <= z -> z <> 0 -> z <> 1 -> (z | 2) -> z = 2
BinIntDef.Z.sgn = fun z : Z => match z with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos _ => 1 | Z.neg _ => -1 end : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sgn _%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qmult_le_l : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} z -> QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qmult z x) (QArith_base.Qmult z y) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y
OMEGA7 : forall x y z t : Z, z > 0 -> t > 0 -> 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x * z + y * t
QArith_base.Qle_trans : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle x y -> QArith_base.Qle y z -> QArith_base.Qle x z
QArith_base.Qle_lt_trans : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle x y -> QArith_base.Qlt y z -> QArith_base.Qlt x z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall p : positive, P (Z.pos p)) -> (forall p : positive, P (Z.neg p)) -> forall z : Z, P z
not_divide1 : forall a b : Z, a <> 1 -> a <> -1 -> b <> 0 -> ~ (a * b | b)
ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus_lt_reg_r : forall x y z : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal, ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus y x) (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus z x) -> ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt y z
not_rel_prime2 : forall x y d : Z, (d | x) -> (d | y) -> d <> 1 -> d <> -1 -> ~ rel_prime x y
QArith_base.Qpower = fun (q : QArith_base.Q) (z : Z) => match z with | 0 => {| QArith_base.Qnum := 1; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} | Z.pos p => QArith_base.Qpower_positive q p | Z.neg p => QArith_base.Qinv (QArith_base.Qpower_positive q p) end : QArith_base.Q -> Z -> QArith_base.Q Arguments QArith_base.Qpower _%Q_scope _%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qmult_le_r : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} z -> QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qmult x z) (QArith_base.Qmult y z) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y
relp_neq : forall m n : Z, m <> 1 -> m <> -1 -> rel_prime m n -> m <> n
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.to_nat = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.pos p => Pos.to_nat p | _ => 0%nat end : Z -> nat Arguments BinIntDef.Z.to_nat _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.abs = fun z : Z => match z with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos p | Z.neg p => Z.pos p end : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.abs _%Z_scope
Zeven = fun z : Z => match z with | 0 | Z.pos (_~0)%positive | Z.neg (_~0)%positive => True | _ => False end : Z -> Prop Arguments Zeven _%Z_scope
Zodd = fun z : Z => match z with | 0 | Z.pos (_~0)%positive | Z.neg (_~0)%positive => False | _ => True end : Z -> Prop Arguments Zodd _%Z_scope
get_signZ = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.neg p => Some (Z.pos p) | _ => None end : Z -> option Z Arguments get_signZ _%Z_scope
IZR = fun z : Z => match z with | 0 => R0 | Z.pos n => IPR n | Z.neg n => (- IPR n)%R end : Z -> R Arguments IZR _%Z_scope : simpl never
not_rel_prime1 : forall x y : Z, ~ rel_prime x y -> exists d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d /\ d <> 1 /\ d <> -1
prime_divisors : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a : Z, (a | p) -> a = -1 \/ a = 1 \/ a = p \/ a = - p
QArith_base.Qplus_le_r : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qplus z x) (QArith_base.Qplus z y) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y
ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus_morph_T = fun (x y : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal) (H : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealEq x y) (z t : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal) (H0 : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealEq z t) => ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealEq_trans (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus x z) (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus x t) (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus y t) match H0 with | conj H1 H2 => conj (fun abs : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus x z) (ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus x t) => let abs0 := ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal_plus_lt_reg_l x z t abs in False_ind False (H1 abs0)) (fun abs : ConstructiveCauch...
Zgcd_spec : forall x y : Z, {z : Z | Zis_gcd x y z /\ 0 <= z}
relp_mult2 : forall a b : Z, rel_prime (a * b) a -> a = 1 \/ a = -1
Zdivide_bounds : forall a b : Z, (a | b) -> b <> 0 -> Z.abs a <= Z.abs b
OMEGA19 : forall x : Z, Zne x 0 -> 0 <= x + -1 \/ 0 <= x * -1 + -1
QArith_base.Qplus_lt_l : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt (QArith_base.Qplus x z) (QArith_base.Qplus y z) < -> QArith_base.Qlt x y
QArith_base.Qplus_le_l : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qplus x z) (QArith_base.Qplus y z) < -> QArith_base.Qle x y

```coq
intros z Hz1 Hzminus1 [k Hk].
assert (H : z <> 0) by (intros H; rewrite H in Hk; simpl in Hk; discriminate).
apply Z_ind with (P := fun z => z <> 1 -> z <> -1 -> (z | 2) -> z = 2 \/ z = -2)
  (z := z).
- intros _. right. reflexivity.
- intros p _ x1 x2 [k Hk].
  rewrite <- Hk. exists 2%Z. 
  rewrite Pos.mul_comm. 
  simpl. 
  destruct (Pos.succ_not_pos).
  all: left; reflexivity.
- intros p _ x1 x2 [k Hk].
  rewrite <- Hk. exists 2%Z. 
  rewrite Pos_pred_succ_mult.
  rewrite Zneg_mult.
  replace (Pos.succ' (Pos.succ' x2))%positive with x1 by reflexivity.
  right. reflexivity.
Qed.
```

original: intros z Hz1 Hzminus1 [k Hk]. assert (H : z <> 0) by (intros H; rewrite H in Hk; simpl in Hk; discriminate). apply Z_ind with (P := fun z => z <> 1 -> z <> -1 -> (z | 2) -> z = 2 \/ z = -2) (z := z). - intros _. right. reflexivity. - intros p _ x1 x2 [k Hk]. rewrite <- Hk. exists 2%Z. rewrite Pos.mul_comm. simpl. destruct (Pos.succ_not_pos). all: left; reflexivity. - intros p _ x1 x2 [k Hk]. rewrite <- Hk. exists 2%Z. rewrite Pos_pred_succ_mult. rewrite Zneg_mult. replace (Pos.succ' (Pos.succ' x2))%positive with x1 by reflexivity. right. reflexivity.
